meanings.definition: A person of distinction or importance.
meanings.sent1: The king and queen were the most prominent personages in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The book was filled with various personages, each with their own unique traits.
meanings.sent3: The personages at the fancy gala all seemed to be competing for attention.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, some personages are like chess pieces, strategically moving to gain power.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted the personages with such detail that they seemed to come to life on the canvas.

meanings.definition: A character in a play or story.
meanings.sent1: The main personage in the play stole the show with their powerful performance.
meanings.sent2: The story was full of colorful personages, each adding depth to the narrative.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous personage in the children's story always caused trouble but with good intentions.
meanings.sent4: The villain in the novel was a dark and complex personage, leaving readers intrigued.
meanings.sent5: The personage in the fairy tale was so enchanting that children would dream of meeting them.

meanings.definition: A group of people of importance or distinction.
meanings.sent1: The gathering of political personages discussed important matters late into the night.
meanings.sent2: The historical painting depicted a group of personages from different eras.
meanings.sent3: The group of personages at the conference all had strong opinions but worked towards a common goal.
meanings.sent4: The personages in the room seemed to exude power and influence with every word spoken.
meanings.sent5: The personages at the event were a mix of celebrities and industry leaders, creating a buzz in the room.
